intro: Zygodia congensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a member of the Commelinaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its striking night-blooming flowers. The flowers are typically white or pale lavender and emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
